+template <int NARGS>

+
+  // The offset for each argument (in bytes). Wrapper around fixed-size array.
+  struct offsets_t {
body: You can't use arrays as return types in C++. On the host you could use `std::array<uint32_t, NARGS>`, but CUDA support for `std::array` isn't great.
body_html: You can't use arrays as return types in C++. On the host you could use std::array<uint32_t, NARGS>, but CUDA support for std::array isn't great.
body_text: You can't use arrays as return types in C++. On the host you could use std::array<uint32_t, NARGS>, but CUDA support for std::array isn't great.
